intro: Oxymitra biglandulosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved oxymitra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Oxymitra biglandulosa make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
